data.chText: （由实践得来的）经验；实践
data.enText: the knowledge and skill that you have gained through doing sth for a period of time; the process of gaining this

data.chText: 有十多年教学经验
data.enText: to have over ten years' teaching experience

data.chText: 你以前干过这种工作吗？
data.enText: Do you have any previous experience of this type of work?

data.chText: 在治疗压力大的病人方面很有经验的医生
data.enText: a doctor with experience in dealing with patients suffering from stress

data.chText: 我缺少实际经验是个不利条件。
data.enText: My lack of practical experience was a disadvantage.

data.chText: 她得到的报酬虽然不高，但有极好的体验。
data.enText: She didn't get paid much but it was all good experience .

data.chText: 从事这项工程使他获得了宝贵的经验。
data.enText: He gained valuable experience whilst working on the project.

data.chText: 我们都从经验中得到教益。
data.enText: We all learn by experience .

data.chText: 经历；阅历
data.enText: the things that have happened to you that influence the way you think and behave

data.chText: 经过的事使我懂得生活可能是很不公平的。
data.enText: Experience has taught me that life can be very unfair.

data.chText: 努力从经验中学习是重要的。
data.enText: It is important to try and learn from experience .

data.chText: 据我的经验看，真正理解这个问题的人很少。
data.enText: In my experience , very few people really understand the problem.

data.chText: 她凭以往的经验知道安是不会轻易放弃的。
data.enText: She knew from past experience that Ann would not give up easily.

data.chText: 本书是根据个人经历写成的。
data.enText: The book is based on personal experience .

data.chText: 对贫穷的直接 / 亲身感受
data.enText: direct/first-hand experience of poverty

data.chText: （一次）经历，体验
data.enText: an event or activity that affects you in some way

data.chText: 愉快、激动人心、异乎寻常、难忘等的经历
data.enText: an enjoyable/exciting/unusual/unforgettable, etc. experience

data.chText: 那是她第一次单独生活。
data.enText: It was her first experience of living alone.

data.chText: 生活在非洲完全不同于在家里，那真是一次不同寻常的经历。
data.enText: Living in Africa was very different from home and quite an experience (= unusual for us) .

data.chText: 我放烟火有过一次不愉快的遭遇。
data.enText: I had a bad experience with fireworks once.

data.chText: 他似乎有某种宗教体验。
data.enText: He seems to have had some sort of religious experience.

data.chText: 传统
data.enText: events or knowledge shared by all the members of a particular group in society, that influences the way they think and behave

data.chText: 诸如爵士乐这类起源于美国黑人传统的音乐形式
data.enText: musical forms like jazz that emerged out of the Black American experience
put sth down to experience
chalk sth up to experience

data.chText: 从…中吸取教训
data.enText: used to say that sb should think of a failure as being sth that they can learn from

data.chText: 我们损失了很多钱，只当是吃一堑长一智了。
data.enText: We lost a lot of money, but we just put it down to experience.

data.chText: 经历；经受；遭受
data.enText: to have a particular situation affect you or happen to you

data.chText: 这个国家经历了几个月的外汇短缺。
data.enText: The country experienced a foreign currency shortage for several months.

data.chText: 每个人在人生的某个阶段都会经历这些问题。
data.enText: Everyone experiences these problems at some time in their lives.

data.chText: 感受；体会；体验
data.enText: to have and be aware of a particular emotion or physical feeling

data.chText: 感到痛苦 / 愉快 / 不幸
data.enText: to experience pain/pleasure/unhappiness

data.chText: 我上飞机时曾一度感到恐慌。
data.enText: I experienced a moment of panic as I boarded the plane.

simple_means.memory_skill: ex 出 + peri 通过；尝试 + ence 状态，行为 → 尝试出来的东西 → 经验

ex.chText: 年轻人要尽快成长需要自己经历事情。
ex.enText: Young men need to experience things for themselves in order to mature as soon as possible.

ex.chText: 很多老年人都遇到过这类问题。
ex.enText: Many old people have experienced such problems.

ex.chText: 他经历了各种艰难困苦。
ex.enText: He experienced all sorts of difficulties and hardships.

synonyms.bx: 强调亲身经历或体验某事物。

ex.chText: 那位教授去年动过大手术吗？
ex.enText: Did that professor undergo a major surgery last year?

ex.chText: 几个沿海城市在过去10年间经历了巨大的变化。
ex.enText: Several coastal cities have undergone massive changes during the last decade.

ex.chText: 新员工要参加一些职业培训。
ex.enText: New employees have to undergo some career training.
She underwent much suffering during her childhood.

synonyms.bx: 尤指经历坎坷、变化或不愉快的事情，也可指接受测试、培训等。

data.enText: put sth down to experience
chalk sth up to experience

data.chText: 从…中吸取教训
data.enText: used to say that sb should think of a failure as being sth that they can learn from

data.chText: 我们损失了很多钱，只当是吃一堑长一智了。
data.enText: We lost a lot of money, but we just put it down to experience.

tr: the accumulation of knowledge or skill that results from direct participation in events or activities
the content of direct observation or participation in an event

example: that painful experience certainly got our attention
The stocks had a fast run-up

tr: have firsthand knowledge of states, situations, emotions, or sensations
example: I have lived a kind of hell when I was a drug addict
The holocaust survivors have lived a nightmare

tr: undergo an emotional sensation or be in a particular state of mind
go through (mental or physical states or experiences)

example: We had many trials to go through
he saw action in Viet Nam

value.def: Experience is knowledge or skill in a particular job or activity, which you have gained because you have done that job or activity for a long time.

example.ex: He has also had managerial experience on every level...
example.tran: 他还有各个层级的管理经验。

example.ex: He's counting on his mother to take care of the twins for him; she's had plenty of experience with them.
example.tran: 他靠母亲帮忙照顾他的双胞胎;她在这方面很有经验。

value.def: Experience is used to refer to the past events, knowledge, and feelings that make up someone's life or character.

example.ex: I should not be in any danger here, but experience has taught me caution...
example.tran: 我在这里应该不会有任何危险，但是经验告诉我要小心。

example.ex: She had learned from experience to take little rests in between her daily routine...
example.tran: 经验告诉她在日常生活中要不时休息一下。

example.ex: 'If you act afraid, they won't let go,' he says, speaking from experience.
example.tran: “如果你表现出害怕，他们就会抓住你不放，”这是他的经验之谈。

value.tran: （组成个人生活或形成个性的）经历，阅历

value.def: An experience is something that you do or that happens to you, especially something important that affects you.

example.ex: Moving had become a common experience for me...
example.tran: 搬家对我而言已经成了常事。

example.ex: His only experience of gardening so far proved immensely satisfying...
example.tran: 到目前为止他唯一的一次园艺经历非常令人满意。

example.ex: Many of his clients are unbelievably nervous, usually because of a bad experience in the past.
example.tran: 他的很多客户神经异常紧张，通常是因为过去有过糟糕的经历。

value.def: If you experience a particular situation, you are in that situation or it happens to you.

example.ex: We had never experienced this kind of holiday before and had no idea what to expect...
example.tran: 我们以前从未有过这样的假期，不知道会怎么样。

example.ex: British business is now experiencing a severe recession.
example.tran: 英国商业现在正经历严重的衰退。

value.def: If you experience a feeling, you feel it or are affected by it.

example.ex: Widows seem to experience more distress than do widowers.
example.tran: 寡妇似乎比鳏夫更痛苦。

trans: 工作经验；工作经历；工作經驗；工作简历；工作履历
个人经验；个人经历；个人体验；个人体会；体认
有用的经验；宝贵的经验（或经历）
用户体验；使用者经验；使用者体验；用户经验；觉得用户体验
工作经验；相关经验；具有相关工作经验；年以上相关经验；相关工作经验要求
经验；根据经验；靠经验；凭经验
情感体验；情绪体验；情感的体验；情感经历；情感经验

rootsaffixes.indicate: = to go through, to try 通过；尝试
rootsaffixes.title: per(i), pir

partsOfSpeech.dec: em 用…做某事；加以…，饰以… + pir 通过；尝试 + ical …的 → 尝试得出经验 → 靠经验办事的
empiric 经验 + ism 表名词 → 经验主义
ex 出 + peri 通过；尝试 + ence 性质，状态，行为 → 尝试出来的东西 → 经验
ex 出 + peri 通过；尝试 + ment 表结果 → 不断尝试 → 实验
per 通过；尝试 + il → 尝试 → 冒险
peril 危险 + ous …的 → 危险的
